title: Tsunami hits Alaska, Hawaii, next set of waves may be 10 feet high
byline: Waves as high as 10 feet are expected to hit Hawaii following an 8.8 magnitude earthquake off the coast of Russia. Authorities across the Pacific are on high alert following the undersea earthquake off the eastern coast of Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula that has triggered tsunami warnings stretching from the northern Kuril Islands to the Hawaiian archipelago and as far east as the western coastline of the United States.

title: Meta launches Instagram teen accounts with parental controls in Sri Lanka
byline: Meta has officially launched supervised teen accounts on Instagram in Sri Lanka, introducing a range of parental control features designed to enhance online safety for young users, the Ministry of Digital Economy said.

title: Wrongfully detained drug suspect dies by suicide
byline: The Mount Lavinia Lawyers’ Association has raised serious concerns over wrongful detentions in drug-related cases following the death of a suspect who was posthumously cleared of all charges.

title: Sri Lanka appreciates Korea’s swift response to migrant worker incident
byline: The Sri Lankan government has expressed appreciation to South Korean President Lee Jae-myung for his prompt response to the viral video showing a Sri Lankan worker being mistreated at a factory in Naju.

title: Trump says ’good friend’ India may face up to 25% tariffs
byline: India could face tariffs as high as 25% if it fails to finalise a trade deal with the US this week, President Donald Trump has said.

title: Prime Minister Harini appointed chairperson of Sri Lanka’s National Commission for UNESCO
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has been appointed as the Chairperson of the Sri Lanka National Commission for the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), the Prime Minister’s Media Division announced.

title: CID warns public of WhatsApp OTP scams
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has issued an urgent warning to the public about fraudulent schemes targeting WhatsApp users through fake calls and messages aimed at stealing One-Time Passwords (OTPs).

title: Will Deshabandu be arrested? Court summons CID to clarify on August 5
byline: Colombo Fort Magistrate Nilupuli Lankapura yesterday (29) issued notice to the Director of Unit 3 of the CID’s Special Investigations Division, instructing him to appear in court on August 5 and clarify whether former Senior DIG Deshabandu Tennakoon is to be arrested.

title: Owner of Hambantota Bird Park released on bail
byline: The owner of the Hambantota Bird Park who was arrested over the illegal import of luxury motorcycles into Sri Lanka, has been released on bail.

title: Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s daughter surrenders
byline: Melanie Abeygunawardena, the daughter of MP Rohitha Abeygunawardena, surrendered to the Panadura-Walana Anti-Vice Squad today in connection with the investigation involving the illegal import and registration of a luxury SUV.

title: Lack of sunlight puts Sri Lankan children at risk, says Paediatrician
byline: Vitamin D deficiency has become a serious health concern amongst children due to lack of sunlight exposure, and this wasn’t an issue around 20-30 years ago, said Consultant Paediatrician Dr. Deepal Perera

title: After X-Press Pearl, Sri Lanka targets another shipping line over marine pollution
byline: In the wake of the landmark judgement delivered by the Supreme Court ordering $ 1 billion as interim compensation over the X-Press Pearl disaster, the Marine Environment Protection Authority (MEPA) of Sri Lanka, along with other stakeholders, initiated action to claim similar payments over the disaster being caused by the Liberia-flagged container ship MSC ELSA 3 that caught fire off Kerala, India recently, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Australia to ban under-16s from YouTube
byline: Australia will use landmark social media laws to ban children under 16 from video-streaming site YouTube, a top minister said Wednesday stressing the need to shield them from ’’predatory algorithms’’.

title: No Tsunami threat in Indian ocean
byline: The Indian Ocean Tsunami Warning and Mitigation System (IOTWS), through its Tsunami Service Provider in Indonesia (InaTEWS-BMKG), has confirmed that there is no tsunami threat in the Indian Ocean following a powerful undersea earthquake that struck off the East Coast of Kamchatka.

title: Japan and US issue tsunami warnings after magnitude 8.8 quake
byline: Japan and the US have issued tsunami warnings after a powerful magnitude 8.8 earthquake struck Russia on Wednesday.

title: New chairman appointed to Sri Jayawardenapura hospital
byline: Dr. Thamara Kalubovila has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Sri Jayawardenapura General Hospital, following the resignation of Dr. Jayanga Tilakaratna, sources confirmed.

title: John Keells responds to claims over BYD vehicle imports
byline: In response to recent media reports and rising public concern over a consignment of BYD electric vehicles imported into Sri Lanka, John Keells CG Auto (Pvt) Ltd (JKCG) has clarified that the vehicles in question were brought in directly from BYD in China and are fully compliant with all local regulations.

title: President taken to court over delay in RTI Commission appointment
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition has been filed before the Supreme Court seeking an order directing the President to appoint an acting Chairperson to the Right to Information (RTI) Commission.

title: Okkampitiya Police OIC arrested for alleged bribery
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Okkampitiya Police Station has been arrested by officials of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Navy apprehends 14 fishermen for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized two Indian fishing boats and apprehended 14 Indian fishermen for allegedly poaching in Sri Lankan territorial waters off Baththalangunduwa and north of Mannar.

title: High-ranking Maldivian state officials meet with President
byline: The Deputy Speaker of the Maldivian Parliament and five cabinet ministers from the Maldivian government visited the Kurumba Maldives resort today (29) to hold discussions with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Nearly 40 killed, tens of thousands evacuated in Chinese floods
byline: At least 40 people were killed in Beijing after the Chinese capital was hit with severe floods following days of heavy rain across the north of the country, authorities said Tuesday.

title: Sri Lanka’s main sugar factories are in danger: Sajith
byline: Highlighting that Sri Lanka’s largest sugar factories are in a precarious situation, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged the government to take urgent steps to safeguard the two entities.

title: Sri Lanka and Singapore sign MoU on AI collaboration
byline: The Ministry of Digital Economy of Sri Lanka and AI Singapore (AISG) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on AI Collaboration yesterday (28) at the National University of Singapore’s Kent Ridge campus.

title: Retired senior DIG Priyantha Jayakody remanded
byline: Retired Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police Priyantha Jayakody, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for allegedly lodging a false complaint, has been remanded until August 6.

title: Sri Lanka ranked the Most Beautiful Island in the World
byline: Sri Lanka has been crowned the most beautiful island in the world, taking the top spot on the list of ’’The 50 Best Islands in the World’’ compiled by global travel site Big 7 Travel.

title: Planned train strike called off
byline: The Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union has called off the 48-hour token strike that was scheduled to commence from midnight today.

title: Army Commander granted one-year service extension
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka granted a one-year service extension to Commander of the Sri Lanka Army, Lieutenant General Lasantha Rodrigo.

title: Motorists exceeding 120 km/h on expressways to face legal action
byline: Motorists caught driving over 120 km/h on expressways will face court proceedings even if fines are paid through the GovPay app, DIG of Traffic and Road Safety, Range Indika Hapugoda said.

title: Sri Lankan Opposition pro Palestine, Government pro Israel?
byline: Responding to a question as to whether Sri Lanka’s Opposition in Parliament is pro Palestine while the government is pro Israel, Opposition MP Mujibur Rahman said today that what the Opposition intends doing is maintaining Sri Lanka’s traditional non-aligned  foreign policy, while the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) led National People’s Power (NPP) government seems to have changed its stance.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for several areas
byline: The Natural Hazards Early Warning Centre of the Department of Meteorology has issued a ’’Warm Weather Advisory – Extreme Caution Level’’ for the Northern, Eastern and North-Central Provinces and the Moneragala and Hambantota districts, valid for tomorrow.

title: Immigration arrests 155 overstaying Indians in biggest detection in history
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration today arrested 155 overstaying Indian nationals from a Colombo office and made them pay fines and visa fees amounting to a staggering Rs.33.6 million, making it the largest and highest valued detection in Sri Lankan history.

title: 90-day free on-arrival tourist visa for Sri Lankan citizens visiting Maldives
byline: The Government of the Maldives has announced that Sri Lankan citizens traveling to the Maldives for tourism purposes will be granted a free 90-day on-arrival tourist visa.

title: Nishantha Ulugetenne further remanded
byline: Former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy, Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne, was further remanded until August 13 following his appearance before the Polgahawela Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Employee arrested for stealing Rs. 7 million worth of office items
byline: A 43-year-old office worker from Kotagala has been arrested for stealing office items, including 35 water filters and 13 televisions, valued at Rs. 7.03 million.

title: Gotabaya willing to give evidence in Lalith-Kugan disappearance probe
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, through his lawyer,  informed the Supreme Court today that he is willing to provide evidence before a Magistrate’s Court over the Habeas Corpus inquiry into the disappearance of two human rights activists, Lalith and Kugan.

title: Crowds gather for Kandy’s Esala festival
byline: Large crowds have already gathered in Kandy to witness the first Kumbal Perahera of the Kandy Esala Festival, set to parade through the city tonight.

title: Court prevents YouTuber ’Sudaa’ from defaming Manusha Nanayakkara
byline: The Colombo District Court today issued an enjoining order restraining YouTuber Sudantha Thilakasiri, also known as ’Sudaa,’ from publishing defamatory statements or content against former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara.

title: TID Investigates: Were LTTE-Era weapons supplied to southern crime gangs?
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Pasan Amarasena today granted permission to detain for 90 days three suspects arrested on allegations of possessing and renting out weapons stockpiled during the LTTE war period to members of the Southern underworld and criminal gangs.

title: Be cautious with new Plastic Credit solutions: Environmentalist warns
byline: The country must exercise extreme caution when adopting new solutions such as plastic credits, the Centre for Environmental Justice (CEJ) chairperson and senior advisor Hemantha Withanage warned.

title: CDF soldier assigned for monitoring electric fence killed in elephant attack
byline: A Civil Defence Forces (CDF) soldier who was engaged in monitoring electric fences has been killed in a wild elephant attack in South Siyambalangamuwa.

title: CEJ urges Defence Ministry to halt issuing guns to kill elephants
byline: The Centre for Environmental Justice (CEJ) has sent a letter of demand to Additional Secretary of the Defence Ministry, P.D. Indika L. Wijegunawardhana, urging the immediate suspension of any process involving the issuance of firearms intended to harm or kill wild elephants.

title: CSE ends higher despite intra-day volatility
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed in positive territory today, following a session marked by sharp volatility. The All Share Price Index (ASPI) initially surged nearly 145 points before retreating by 148 points mid-session.

title: Hasalaka OIC violated woman’s fundamental rights by arresting her clothing with ship wheel, rules SC
byline: The Supreme Court declared that the former Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Hasalaka Police Station had violated the Fundamental Rights of a woman who was arrested and detained for wearing an item of clothing bearing a ship’s wheel, which was mistakenly interpreted as a depiction of the Dhammachakra.

title: Petition filed in Supreme Court challenging Indo-Lanka Digital Identity Deal
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking an order preventing the government from proceeding with the Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and India on the implementation of the Sri Lanka Unique Digital Identity (SLUDI) Program, funded through a grant from the Government of India.
